title: Bookmarks added to the bookmark toolbar do not stick after Firefox restart
content: This problem began over the past week. Bookmarks can be dragged to the bookmarks toolbar and they function until restarting Firefox. Then they do not appear. True for several bookmarks. The bookmarks remain in the recent list and are functional there. Tried moving and rebuilding the places.sqlite files, which did not solve the problem. Tried Places maintenance without effect.

title: Trying to reinstall FF but vcruntime140_1.dll was not found
content:
I open FF on new (installed FF and it was working for 2 days) win 11 desktop and it did not work. When I open it some stuff was missing so I shot it down and hit restart. That did not help so after trying a few things I uninstalled and reinstalled. On reinstalling I received message the code execution cannot proceed because vcruntime140_1.dll was not found. Followed instructions to go to MS and download 32bit+64bit to fix problem. I restarted and tried to reload FF again. The same problem happen again. So, I tried to reload 32+64 bit from MS, uninstalled and reinstalled. Tried to reload FF but getting same message. Probably uninstalled FF 5 or 6 times. Wondering if I screwed up win 11 system by uninstalling so many times. Have any ideas, getting tired of playing with FF.






'
creator: LOST421

title: Problema con combinazione di tasti
content:
Scrivendo nel mio editor testo online non ho mai avuto problemi con la combinazione tasti ALT+0171 ed ALT+0187 per scrivere le cosiddette virgolette caporali.

Da qualche settimana non riesco più a farlo. Quando faccio la combinazione dei tasti la pagina dell'editor è come si chiudesse aprendosi in una nuova pagina, il cursore finisce nella barra dell'url scrivendo la virgoletta. Poiché faccio largo uso di queste due combinazioni di tasti è veramente snervante.

Qualcuno riesce ad aiutarmi?

title: How to disable insecure password warnings (on local sites)?
content:
Hi there. I'm a web developer. I have many local sites on my computer on various domains that work via http. I need to login into them many times during day, but every time I have a FF warning about "this connection is not secure". It makes no sense to work with them through https. I try to disable warning by to "about:config" options: security.insecure_password.ui.enabled = false security.insecure_field_warning.contextual.enabled = false but it wasn't work. Can anyone help me with this?

P.S That options above works fine until the last update or something.

P.P.S. I really don't know why FF does not allow me to add some site's into whitelist or something like that...

title: Youtube video skip/seek bar - causes white loading screen when trying to forward video
content:
The issue i have noticed is when watching any YouTube video and if i decide to skip to a different time in the video it will cause it to go to a white screen, loads for at least 1-10seconds and then starts the video playback ( it can take multiple skips to get this white loading screen to come up ). Some cases the video quality will drop to 720P when i have set it to 1080P. I have attached the screenshot what it looks like as well as the stats for nerds page showing network connectivity stats.

-I thought it was my computer until i tested this with multiple computers as well as on different network connections ( speeds up to 100mbps and even higher download speeds ) -Firefox has been completely uninstalled and reinstalled -tested in troubleshooting mode + no add-ons installed -Same on Private Mode and Normal Mode -updated to version 104.0.1 but i think this fix was for a different YouTube issue -I even downloaded an older version like version 80 or 90 if i remember and still had it happen -Tried using some YouTube extensions like YouTube enhancer but that seems to just allow you to force the video a specific resolution

As mentioned above to try and reproduce this issue, open any YouTube Video and just start skipping the video to random timeframes and see if it gets the white loading screen. I understand that when skipping the video it will start to buffer and this normally takes couple of seconds and starts playing. But with this white loading screen it can take up to 10 seconds to load and then starts playing

Same issue described on Reddit https://old.reddit.com/r/firefox/comments/vhbce5/firefox_is_lowering_youtube_video_quality_randomly/
creator: constaz

title: How to clear History, Bookmarks, Cookies on old laptop without affecting new laptop?
content:

As I will give my old laptop to someone, I would like to clear Firefox completely of all private informations such as History, Bookmarks, Cookies, Passwords, etc. (basically everything). However, as I synchronized all these information by logging in on my new laptop, I want to make sure I don't lose these information on my new one. How to ensure deleting everything on my old laptop won't affect my new one ? Don't want to make that mistake...

title: Active tab border
content:
Hello, From FF 99 I have removed the floating tabs with CSS code but after updating to 104 instead of the active tab being differentiated with a shadow it now has a black border. Is there any way to change that back while still keeping the CSS code I have for the floating tabs?

The code I have is: .tab-background{ border-radius: 0px 0px !important; margin-bottom: 0px !important; } .tabbrowser-tab:not([selected=true]):not([multiselected=true]) .tab-background{ background-color: color-mix(in srgb, currentColor 5%, transparent); } .tab-background{ border-color: transparent !important }

Thanks.
